dict.string: Citation picker and lightweight references manager for `.bib` files
Add DOI / ISBN to BibTeX Library

[{"title":"‚úçÔ∏è Search & download .csl files","arg":"csl","subtitle":""},{"title":"üí¨ Change citation format","arg":"change_format","subtitle":"current: \"{var:_format_current_citation_style}\""},{"title":"üîÅ Buffer reload","arg":"buffer_reload","subtitle":""},{"title":"‚ùìCheatsheet","arg":"cheatsheet","subtitle":"of available actions"}]

CSL_DIR=~/.pandoc/csl/
mkdir -p "$CSL_DIR" cd "$CSL_DIR"
curl -sO "$*"
# for notification echo "$*"

[{"title":"Pandoc","arg":"pandoc","subtitle":"[@citekey, p. 42]"},{"title":"Formatted single entry","arg":"formatted single entry","subtitle":"in APA or the custom .csl style ‚ÑπÔ∏è page numbers and multiple entries not supported"},{"title":"Org Mode","arg":"org","subtitle":"[cite:@citekey, p. 42]"},{"title":"Multi-Markdown (MMD)","arg":"multi-markdown","subtitle":"[42][#citekey]"},{"title":"Latex","arg":"latex","subtitle":"\\cite{citekey} ‚ÑπÔ∏è page numbers not supported"},{"title":"Wikilink","arg":"wikilink","subtitle":"[[citekey]] ‚ÑπÔ∏è page number will become alias"},{"title":"Eta template","arg":"eta","subtitle":"{% cite citekey %}"},{"title":"iA Writer","arg":"iA Writer","subtitle":"[^citekey, p. 42]"},{"title":"Tag","arg":"tag","subtitle":"#citekey"},{"title":"Bare citekey","arg":"bare citekey","subtitle":"citekey"},{"title":"Bracketed citekey","arg":"bracketed citekey","subtitle":"(citekey)"}]
This cannot be undone. [‚Üµ]: Confirm [Esc]: Cancel

export PATH=/usr/local/bin:$PATH
citekey="{query}" bibfile=~`echo -n $bibtex_library_path | sed -e "s/~//"` csl=~`echo -n $csl_file | sed -e "s/~//"` dummyBib="---
nocite: |
 "$citekey"
---
::: {#refs}
:::"
echo -n $dummyBib | pandoc --citeproc --read=markdown --write=plain --csl $csl --bibliography $bibfile | tr "
" " "

## Workflow setup 1. Add the path to your `.bib` to the right. 2. Set the [hotkeys](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/triggers/hotkey/).
### Set citation style The default citation style is *Pandoc Citations*. To switch it to LaTeX, Multi-Markdown, Org Mode, eta, [[wikilinks]], #tags, or bare citkeys use the keyword `scp` in Alfred and select `Change Citation Format`.
> ‚ÑπÔ∏è > Due to technical restrictions, you may need to set the citation style once > more after updates to this workflow.
---
## Basic usage Press the [hotkey](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/triggers/hotkey/) in any text field to start the citation picker. Alternatively, use the `ct` keyword.
### Search - You can search for the title, author/editor (last name), year, collection, or journal name. - Prepend `@` to a word to search for a citekey, for example `@Grieser2020`. - Prepend `#` to search for keywords (tags), for example `#sociology`. - *Smart queries*: You can search for any combination of the above. For example, the query `2020 #cognition grieser` searches for entries published in 2020, with the tag "cognition," and with "Grieser" as author/editor.
### Citation actions - <kbd>‚èé</kbd>: Paste the citekey of the selected citation. - <kbd>‚å•</kbd><kbd>‚èé</kbd>: Add another citation. - <kbd>‚áß</kbd><kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚Üµ</kbd>: Paste an inline-citation (citation without surrounding formatting, for example `@Grieser2022` instead of `[@Grieser2022]`) - <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚èé</kbd>: Add page numbers before pasting the selected citekey. - Confirm the page number with <kbd>‚å•</kbd><kbd>‚Üµ</kbd> (or <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚èé</kbd>) to add another citation afterward. - Confirm with <kbd>‚áß</kbd><kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚èé</kbd> for an inline-citation with page number (`@Grieser2022 [p. 42]`).
### URL actions - <kbd>‚åÉ</kbd><kbd>‚èé</kbd>: Open the URL in the browser. - <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>C</kbd>: Copy the URL to the clipboard. - In both cases, if the entry has a DOI but not a URL, the citation picker uses the DOI-URL (`https://doi.org/‚Ä¶`) instead.
## Many more features - Use the keyword `scp` to access some auxiliary features. - For all the features this workflow has to offer, refer to the [README](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/alfred-bibtex-citation-picker#table-of-contents).
---
## Cite this software project
If you want to mention this software project in an academic publication, please cite it as:
`Grieser, C. (2023). Supercharged Citation Picker [Computer software]. https://github.com/chrisgrieser/alfred-bibtex-citation-picker`
For other citation styles, use the following metadata: [cff file](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/alfred-bibtex-citation-picker/blob/main/CITATION.cff)
## Created by [Chris Grieser](https://chris-grieser.de/)
enclose page numbers in brackets & add citation

DOUBLE CLICK THIS
to set a hotkey for the citation picker

DOUBLE CLICK THIS
to set a hotkey for adding DOI/ISBN
Keyword for the citation picker. Alternatively, the citation picker can also be triggered via hotkey.

Folder containing your PDFs. Only required for indicating PDFs via icons, opening them via `Hyper‚Üµ`, or auto-filing PDFs via with `fn‚Üµ`. When left empty, `Hyper‚Üµ` tries to fall back to the PDF listed in the bibtex file under the key `file`.
Folder containing your literature notes (as markdown files). Only required for indicating literature notes via icon, and for creating/opening literature notes with `‚å•‚åÉ‚Üµ`.
Folder where downloaded citation styles will be saved. Only required for downloading citation styles via `scp` ‚Üí `Citation styles` or via `csl`.

App to open entries in when using `‚áß‚Üµ`. Reference managers will reveal the entry, while text editors will open the .bib file at the line containing the entry. ("default app" does not support opening at a specific line.)
Given the year "1990", short years will only match "90".
Whether the citation picker should match authors names that are in the et al. (If you have papers with hundreds of co-authors, you can disable this to improve matching.)
Custom .csl file for the single-bibliography-pasting. (If empty, defaults to APA-7th.)
Copy the Pandoc citation to the clipboard.

Length of the entry titles to be shown. Alfred truncates in the middle, while for citations, it is preferrable to truncate at the end, thus this setting. (This setting is purely aesthetic and has no effect on the behavior of the citation picker.)
